results.title: Aspirations
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
Education, political reform, and technology are all being used to serve the aims of the society of North Africa and the Middle East. The primary aim is liberation from colonial control and from the grip of poverty. Throughout the region this film finds much new development, aimed for the most part at the production of larger, more varied crops and the organization of new industry. Within sight of the waterwheels of antiquity can be seen the rise of vast power dams and pumping stations, and beyond mud villages steel and concrete cities, schools and factories can be seed.

results.title: Asphalt Lake
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and A. Frank Bundy
results.brief_description: After giving examples of the everyday uses of asphalt for road-makling and roofing, this film shows the position of Pitch Lake at La Brea, Trinidad on a large-scale map. Details the work carried out at the lakeside, and in the refineries.
results.description: After giving examples of the everyday uses of asphalt for road-makling and roofing, this film shows the position of Pitch Lake at La Brea, Trinidad on a large-scale map. Details the work carried out at the lakeside, and in the refineries.

results.title: Aspects of Central Place
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark, Eric Harrison and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
This film uses the Cambridge area of the United Kingdom to discuss the applicability of Christaller’s central place theory in a modern context. Explains the forces that have given growth to the city of Cambridge and the functions of centres at different levels of the settlement hierarchy in Canmbridge. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.

results.title: Aspects of behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hart and Communication Research Media Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Relating psychology to the student’s life experience this film considers ethical issues such as obedience and authority along with prejudice and attitude change. It also examines questions like: what does a social psychologist do? How does physiology relate to behaviour? Do psychologists often agree? What is cultural psychology?

results.title: Askja on fire: volcanic eruption in Iceland 1961
results.brief_description: Shows the massive eruption of the volcano Askja in the central highlands of Iceland in 1961. Presents contrasting scenes of the glowing molten lava against a background of snow and ice. Narrated by Brian D. Holt. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.title_for_label: Askja on fire: volcanic eruption in Iceland 1961

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Kay Roberts
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Turkish.

results.title: Ask an Australian about surfing [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Alex Ezard
results.brief_description: Shows the dangers of swimming in the surf. The role that surf life-saving clubs play on a surf beach is explained. The importance of observing safety precautions, such as swimming between the flags and clearing the water when the shark alarm is sounded is emphasised Note: In Turkish.
